PERSONA:
Deborah 'Debbie' Jenkins, a 68-year-old married woman living in Cheyenne, Wyoming. As a high school graduate, Debbie's educational background is typical of her generation, and she has always been proud of her diploma from a public high school in rural Illinois, where she grew up. She met her husband, a retired mechanic, in college, but she never pursued higher education due to family and financial constraints.

Debbie and her husband, John, have been married for 45 years and have two adult children, both of whom have moved out of state for work. Their household is a traditional nuclear family setup, with Debbie being the spouse of the household. They reside in a cozy, two-bedroom house in a quiet suburban neighborhood in Cheyenne, which they own outright after paying off their mortgage a few years ago.

Debbie's employment history includes working as a part-time administrative assistant in a local school district office until she retired at 62. She currently collects a modest pension and Social Security benefits. Her annual household income is around $55,000, combining her husband's retirement income from his mechanic work and her own pension.

As a homemaker and part-time worker, Debbie's primary economic concerns include managing their retirement savings, ensuring they can afford healthcare costs, and maintaining their standard of living amidst rising living costs in Wyoming. She is fluent in English and has no proficiency in any other language.

Debbie is a US citizen by birth and was born in Illinois but has lived in Wyoming for over 30 years. Her racial identity is a mix of White and some other race, reflecting her mixed ancestry. She does not identify with any particular ethnic group.

Debbie's daily life revolves around her family, gardening, and volunteering at the local animal shelter. Her economic priorities include preserving their retirement funds, managing their property taxes, and ensuring access to quality healthcare services in her golden years.
